content:
Selam  

Today we have merged objective's, result's and milestone's datasets and processed it to make it suitable for fine-tuning our LLM model by changing it to question and answer form. 
We have encountered challenge on using the LLM model in colab as google colab provide limited GPU for limited time.
Tomorrow we plan to further analyze our data and test other LLM models to check their performance on our scenario. we will also plan to use RAG using OKR documentation.
creator: Kidus Girma

content: selam  Today our team made solid progress on Basecamp data fetching and used it to power our AI recommendation system. We also built a clean UI showing each workflow step—from data fetch to smart replies and AI insights. I’ll continue improving this while also studying for my DP-100 exam.

content: selam  today i have gathered some info on how we can implement the proposed internship project and and personally i have watched some videos on how we can intergrate different versions of LLM into our project,and we have plans for session tomorrow where we will discuss the internship project as well as the DP 100 exam.
creator: Mesay Assegid

content:
Selam
Today

Today:
We worked with the LLaMA 2 model ,to download it to google colab and  fine-tuning using Hugging Face data.
Reviewed today's dataset and explored using RAG for better context handling.
Requested access to LLaMA 3 and are awaiting approval.


Challenge:
The 15GB GPU on Google Colab was too limited for proper fine-tuning.
Even with quantization, PEFT, and small batch sizes, performance was inadequate.
We need a server with at least 30GB GPU memory to continue.


Tomorrow:
We'll clean and structure today's data into prompt–response pairs.
Prepare it for the next round of training and evaluation.
Focus will be on readiness for fine-tuning with improved resources.
creator: Telaynew Ambachew

content:
Selam  

Today, we utilized the LLaMA 2 model and attempted fine-tuning using example data sourced from Hugging Face. We also explored the data received today and discussed how Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) can be integrated into our project to improve context-aware responses.

As LLaMA 3 requires special access on Hugging Face, we submitted a request for access and are currently waiting for approval.


Challenges Encountered:

Despite applying optimization techniques such as quantization, PEFT (Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning), and using a minimal batch size, we found that the Google Colab GPU (with 15GB of memory) was insufficient for fine-tuning the model effectively. Therefore, we kindly request access to a server with at least 30GB of dedicated GPU memory to proceed with training.

Plan for Tomorrow:
Our goal for tomorrow is to organize the data received today and format it into structured prompt data suitable for training and evaluation in the next phases.
creator: Teklemariam Shewamnil
